intro: Chorizema spathulatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved chorizema, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. The species is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in succulent gardens.
